definitions.definition: (of a person) utter a loud call or cry, typically as an expression of a strong emotion.
synonyms: call at the top of one's voice

definitions.definition: say something very loudly; call out.
examples: he leaned out of his window and shouted abuse at them

definitions.definition: speak loudly and angrily to; insult or scold loudly.
examples: he apologized because he had shouted at her in front of them all

definitions.definition: prevent someone from speaking or being heard by shouting.
examples: he was shouted down as he tried to explain the decision

definitions.definition: indicate or express (a particular quality or characteristic) unequivocally or powerfully.
examples: from crocodile handbag to gold-trimmed shoes, she shouted money
anyone shooting a hole in one must shout for all players present on the course

definitions.definition: a loud cry expressing a strong emotion or calling attention.
examples: his words were interrupted by warning shouts

definitions.definition: one's turn to buy a round of drinks.
examples: “Do you want another drink? My shout.”
